Crab, Monstrous

Long spindly spider-like legs. Two monstrous claws protrude from the front of its body.



Monstrous Crab

CR 2

XP 600
N Medium vermin (aquatic)
Init +1; Senses darkvision 60 ft.; Perception +4
DEFENSE
AC 16, touch 11, flat-footed 15 (+1 Dex, +5 natural)
hp 19 (3d8+6)
Fort +5, Ref +2, Will +1
Immune vermin traits
Weaknesses water dependency
OFFENSE
Spd 30 ft., swim 20 ft.
Melee 2 claws +4 (1d4+2 plus grab)
Space 5 ft.; Reach 5 ft.
Special Attacks constrict (claw) 1d4+2
STATISTICS
Str 14, Dex 12, Con 14, Int -, Wis 10, Cha 2
Base Atk +2; CMB +4 (+8 to grapple); CMD 15
Skills Perception +4, Swim +10; Racial Modifiers +4 Perception
ECOLOGY
Environment Temperate or warm aquatic
Organization Solitary or swarm (2-12)
Treasure None
SPECIAL ABILITIES
Water Dependency (Ex) Monstrous crabs can survive out of the water for 1 hour per point of Constitution. Beyond this limit, a monstrous crab runs the risk of suffocation, as if it were drowning.


Monstrous crabs are omnivores and spend most of their time combing the ocean floors for food. Many act as vegetarians and sustain themselves on a diet of algae, fungus, and water-based plants, while others act as scavengers or predators. Some have been known to actively hunt giant clams and snails (the monstrous crab pries the shell open and devours the fleshy innards). Still others prefer to dwell in coastal waters and prey upon land-based creatures that wander too close to the shoreline.

Monstrous crabs are often hunted as food by other races (particularly humans and sahuagin).
